verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Sanctify unto me all the firstborn, whatsoever openeth the womb among the children of Israel, both of man and of beast: it is mine.
verses.ct: "Dedicate to me every firstborn — every first child and first offspring of every animal among the Israelites. They belong to me."

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto the people, Remember this day, in which ye came out from Egypt, out of the house of bondage; for by strength of hand the LORD brought you out from this place: there shall no leavened bread be eaten.
verses.ct: Moses told the people, "Remember this day — the day you left Egypt, the land where you were slaves. The LORD brought you out of this place with his mighty power. No bread made with yeast may be eaten."

verses.kjv: This day came ye out in the month Abib.
verses.ct: "Today you are leaving, in the month of Abib."

verses.kjv: And it shall be when the LORD shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, which he sware unto thy fathers to give thee, a land flowing with milk and honey, that thou shalt keep this service in this month.
verses.ct: "When the LORD brings you into the land of the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Hivites, and Jebusites — the land he promised to your ancestors he would give you, a land rich with milk and honey — you must observe this ceremony during this month."

verses.kjv: Seven days thou shalt eat unleavened bread, and in the seventh day shall be a feast to the LORD.
verses.ct: "For 7 days you must eat bread made without yeast, and on the 7th day there will be a festival to the LORD."

verses.kjv: Unleavened bread shall be eaten seven days; and there shall no leavened bread be seen with thee, neither shall there be leaven seen with thee in all thy quarters.
verses.ct: "Bread without yeast must be eaten throughout the 7 days. No bread with yeast should be found anywhere among you, and no yeast should be found anywhere in your territory."

verses.kjv: And thou shalt shew thy son in that day, saying, This is done because of that which the LORD did unto me when I came forth out of Egypt.
verses.ct: "On that day, explain it to your son by saying, 'I do this because of what the LORD did for me when I came out of Egypt.'"

verses.kjv: And it shall be for a sign unto thee upon thine hand, and for a memorial between thine eyes, that the LORD’s law may be in thy mouth: for with a strong hand hath the LORD brought thee out of Egypt.
verses.ct: "This observance will serve as a reminder on your hand and between your eyes, so that the LORD's instructions will always be on your lips. For the LORD brought you out of Egypt with his mighty power."

verses.kjv: Thou shalt therefore keep this ordinance in his season from year to year.
verses.ct: "You must observe this regulation at its appointed time every year."

verses.kjv: And it shall be when the LORD shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanites, as he sware unto thee and to thy fathers, and shall give it thee,
verses.ct: "When the LORD brings you into the land of the Canaanites, just as he promised you and your ancestors, and gives it to you,"

verses.kjv: That thou shalt set apart unto the LORD all that openeth the matrix, and every firstling that cometh of a beast which thou hast; the males shall be the LORD’s.
verses.ct: "you must set apart for the LORD every firstborn that opens the womb. Every first male offspring from your livestock belongs to the LORD."

verses.kjv: And every firstling of an ass thou shalt redeem with a lamb; and if thou wilt not redeem it, then thou shalt break his neck: and all the firstborn of man among thy children shalt thou redeem.
verses.ct: "Every firstborn donkey must be bought back with a lamb. If you don't buy it back, you must break its neck. Every firstborn son among your children you must also buy back."

verses.kjv: And it shall be when thy son asketh thee in time to come, saying, What is this? that thou shalt say unto him, By strength of hand the LORD brought us out from Egypt, from the house of bondage:
verses.ct: "In the future, when your son asks you, 'What does this mean?' you will tell him, 'The LORD brought us out of Egypt with his mighty power — out of the land where we were slaves."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Pharaoh would hardly let us go, that the LORD slew all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both the firstborn of man, and the firstborn of beast: therefore I sacrifice to the LORD all that openeth the matrix, being males; but all the firstborn of my children I redeem.
verses.ct: "When Pharaoh stubbornly refused to let us go, the LORD killed every firstborn in the land of Egypt — both the firstborn of people and the firstborn of animals. That is why I sacrifice to the LORD every first male offspring that opens the womb, but I buy back every firstborn son.'"

verses.kjv: And it shall be for a token upon thine hand, and for frontlets between thine eyes: for by strength of hand the LORD brought us forth out of Egypt.
verses.ct: "This will serve as a sign on your hand and a symbol between your eyes, because the LORD brought us out of Egypt with his mighty power."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Pharaoh had let the people go, that God led them not through the way of the land of the Philistines, although that was near; for God said, Lest peradventure the people repent when they see war, and they return to Egypt:
verses.ct: When Pharaoh released the people, God did not lead them along the road through Philistine territory, even though that was the shorter route. God said, "If the people encounter war, they might change their minds and go back to Egypt."

verses.kjv: But God led the people about, through the way of the wilderness of the Red sea: and the children of Israel went up harnessed out of the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: Instead, God led the people on a roundabout path through the wilderness toward the Red Sea. The Israelites left Egypt prepared for battle.

verses.kjv: And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him: for he had straitly sworn the children of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you; and ye shall carry up my bones away hence with you.
verses.ct: Moses brought Joseph's bones along, because Joseph had made the Israelites swear a solemn oath, saying, "God will certainly come to help you, and when he does, you must carry my bones with you from this place."

verses.kjv: And they took their journey from Succoth, and encamped in Etham, in the edge of the wilderness.
verses.ct: They left Succoth and set up camp at Etham, on the edge of the wilderness.

verses.kjv: And the LORD went before them by day in a pillar of a cloud, to lead them the way; and by night in a pillar of fire, to give them light; to go by day and night:
verses.ct: The LORD went ahead of them — during the day in a column of cloud to guide their way, and at night in a column of fire to give them light — so they could travel both day and night.

verses.kjv: He took not away the pillar of the cloud by day, nor the pillar of fire by night, from before the people.
verses.ct: The column of cloud never left its place ahead of the people during the day, and the column of fire never left during the night.
